snippet: After years of declining budgets for the care of New York City’s street trees, city officials and lawmakers more than doubled the amount for the fiscal year that began this week.
abstract: New York City Council adds $2 million for tree pruning to the $1.45 million in Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's proposed budget, part of $30 million worth of last-minute restorations to the parks department's budget; poorly maintained trees have been responsible for injuries and at least one death in recent years.
lead_paragraph: After years of declining budgets for the care of New York City’s street trees, city officials and lawmakers more than doubled the amount for the fiscal year that began this week.

headline.seo: New York Officials Raise Budget for Street Tree Care
headline.main: After Accidents and Lawsuits, More Money for Tree Care
headline.print_headline: After Accidents And Lawsuits, More Money For Tree Care
